A nice "no-brained" romance novel. Meaning I can read it and be entertained yet not need much brainpower to do so. Not much thinking involved.

review.body: さすが神永学。八雲シリーズ程ではないが、やっぱり5つ星の面白さ。

book.title: Theory for Classics: A Student's Guide

review.body: So far, fantastic book that addresses art-historical theory and philosophy since the Enlightenment in a way that is applicable and useful for Classicists. A must-read for any Classical Archaeologist.

I never read any reviews of the this book when it came out; it seemed to completely pass me and many of the newspapers by. I expect many critics dismissed the book. book.title: The Myth of the Goddess: Evolution of an Image

review.body: One of the most absurd analyses of iconographic tradition I have ever encountered, written by people who have no experience addressing material remains in any capacity and do it poorly. Tries far too hard to fit art and other historical objects into a historical/religious tradition which they have c... more...

I was unaware of the Flat Stanley phenomenon and how old the book was. I checked it out from the library and I love it. It's silly and a classic children's book I can't wait to add to my bookshelf. And we'll definitely be making Flat Stanley a member of our family.
First read: April 20, 2010, then Dec 8, 2010

People often quote Machiavelli wrongly. They often picture him as a man of no morals teaching a young prince on the foulest possible ways of achieving and keeping power; people demonize and avoid his teachings as a sure path to corruption. What they fail to realize, however, was that that very same ... more...

book.title: Horton Hears a Who!

review.body: Good ears, Horton. Good ears. Horton clearly didn't attend ANY good concerts in his youth.

book.title: Fat, Forty, Fired: One Man's Frank, Funny, and Inspiring Account of Losing His Job and Finding His Life

review.body: Fun, I appreciated the stories of the father trying to do the "mother's" job - taking the son to school, the daughters to gymnastics.
